newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen B shares lower on eve of Changan debut.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen B shares lower on eve of Changan debut.

text.p: Shenzhen's B share index gave up early gains and closed slightly lower on Thursday, with investors reducing their positions ahead of Friday's listing of Chongqing Changan Automobile Co Ltd's 250 million B shares, brokers said.
The B share index shed 0.21 points, or 0.23 percent, to 89.35 on turnover of HK$12.79 million, down from HK$21.65 million on Thursday.
Some investors took funds out of existing issues to prepare for Changan's first day of trading, brokers said.
Property issue China Vanke lost HK$0.12, or 2.99 percent, to HK$3.90 in thin trade of 3,190 shares.

Building materials producer Fangda fell HK$0.10, or 2.27 percent, to HK$4.30 as 73,600 shares were traded on profit-taking, brokers said. Dadonghai traded the most on volume of 1.59 million shares and slipped HK$0.02 to HK$1.30.
China Marine continued to drop on profit-taking by institutions, brokers said. The counter slid HK$0.13 to HK$5.95 after 823,300 shares changed hands.
Beverage maker Shenbao was the star on speculative buying, brokers said. The counter rose HK$0.10, or 4.44 percent, to HK$2.35, with 30,500 shares changing hands.
The A share market fell slightly, with an increasing number of investors believing the market has entered a consolidation period following a surge since April, brokers said.

The A share index fell 2.58 points, or 0.68 percent, to 373.86, with turnover falling to 5.18 billion yuan from 6.83 billion on Wednesday. The composite index lost 2.34 points, or 0.67 percent, to 348.23.
Chemical fibre maker Kunshan Sanshan felt the brunt of institutional profit-taking, brokers said. The counter tumbled 1.05 yuan, or 9.95 percent, to 9.50 yuan.
Paints producer Nanjing Tianlong followed suit, dropping 0.52 yuan, or 6.42 percent, to 7.58 yuan.

Yueyang Hengli Aircooling Equipment Inc, which listed 10 million A shares and three million staff shares in Shenzhen on Thursday, ended the session at 14.00 yuan per share on trade of 9.26 million shares.
The A shares were issued at 5.98 yuan per share in October, and the employee shares offered at one yuan per share in 1993.
